summary: Since 1974, the Shadow Wolves—a highly trained Native American investigations unit—have used traditional and modern methods to combat smuggling from Mexico to the Tohono O'odham Nation reservation in Arizona. They're part of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. In our third report on this topic, we assessed ICE's progress in addressing our 6 prior recommendations to improve the Shadow Wolves program. ICE fully addressed 1 and...
title: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement: Actions Still Needed to Improve Planning and Management of Its Native American Law Enforcement Unit
